Field.Label: ^ Select MQTT to specify the connection details for the MQTT Broker published to by Zigbee2MQTT.
Select ZIGBEE to setup the Indigo devices that map to the Zigbee devices published by Zigbee2MQTT.
^ User definable prefix on the MQTT Broker being connected to. The plugin appends '-Dnnnnnn' (where nnnnnn is the device Id of this device) in order to make the name unique.
^ Select required MQTT Protocol. MQTTv311 is the default and this works with the Indigo MQTT Broker plugin.
^ Must be the MQTT Broker IP Address used by Zigbee2MQTT
^ Must be the username required to access the MQTT Broker. Leave empty if not used.
^ Password required to access the MQTT Broker. Leave empty if not used.
^ Select the Zigbee device to show its details and properties.
Indicates if the contact is closed (= true) or open (= false)
Indicates if the battery of this device is almost empty
Indicates whether the device is tampered
Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
Indicates whether the device detected occupancy
. Press pairing button right before changing this otherwise it will fail.
Time interval for detecting actions. Press pairing button right before changing this otherwise it will fail.
When this option is enabled then blue LED will blink once when motion is detected. Press pairing button right before changing this otherwise it will fail.
Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
Voltage of the battery in millivolts
Indicates if the contact is closed (= true) or open (= false)
Indicates if the battery of this device is almost empty
Indicates whether the device is tampered
Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
Indicates whether the device detected occupancy
Voltage of the battery in millivolts
Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
Indicates whether the device detected presence
Number of power outages (since last pairing)
Monitoring mode with or without considering right and left sides
The distance at which the sensor detects approaching
Different sensitivities means different static human body recognition rate and response speed of occupied
Reset the status of no presence

Most recent region event. Event template is "region_<REGION_ID>_<EVENT_TYPE>", where <REGION_ID> is region number (1-10), <EVENT_TYPE> is one of "enter", "leave", "occupied", "unoccupied". "enter" / "leave" events are usually triggered first, followed by "occupied" / "unoccupied" after a couple of seconds.
Indicates if the contact is closed (= true) or open (= false)

Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.

"enter" / "leave" events are usually triggered first, followed by "occupied" / "unoccupied" after a couple of seconds.
